meta.content: Southwestern Heights, USD483, SWH, Southwestern Heights KS, SWH KS, Southwestern Heights High School, Southwestern Heights Junior High School, Southwestern Height Junior High, Plains Elementary, Kismet Elementary, PES, KES, Plains KS, Kismet KS

span.font: Plains Elementary will join students around the nation for the National Field Day Event in May! This free event is for all family members to enjoy - indoors or out. This will be our alternative for Little Olympics. More info coming soon!

strong.font: Southwestern Heights wishes to announce the valedictorian and salutatorian of the graduating class of 2020. Dan Frisby, Principal, has announced Yolanda Morales, daughter of Claudia Ruiz, as valedictorian for the graduating class of 2020. Esmeralda Duran, daughter of Gustavo Duran and Laura Gomez, was announced as salutatorian. These selections are based on the students’ cumulative grade point averages throughout high school. Yolanda has been involved in National Honor Society, Track, FFA, Band, Pep Band, Basketball, FCCLA, and KAYs. She plans to attend Seward County Community College for two years and transfer to a university and major in Secondary Education. Esmeralda has been involved in National Honor Society, Softball, KAYs, and FCCLA. She plans to attend Seward County Community College for two years and then transfer on to a university and major in Accounting. Both students were also named as Kansas Honor Scholars in the fall by the University of Kansas for being in the top ten percent of their graduating class. Southwestern Heights congratulates these students for their achievements and wishes them well in their future endeavors.

Families of students who attend Kismet, Plains, and SWH:
Please fill out the internet access survey as soon as possible.

a.font: CLICK HERE TO FILL OUT THE FORM

strong.font: We are aware of the Governor's decision to immediately cancel the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. We are working to gain more information and guidance. We will make information available as we are able.

strong.font:
Spring Break for USD 483 will be March 16 - March 20. The end of the 3rd nine weeks is Friday, March 13 and there is only a half day of school. School resumes on Monday, March 23.
Have a safe and great break!

span.font: First annual Student Council/NHS Dodgeball Tournament was held on Tuesday, March 10, 2020. There were four teams registered; The Benchwarmers, The Classics, The Incredibles, and Oldies but Goodies. Teams competed in a round-robin, followed by bracket play to determine the champions. Congratulations to the Benchwarmers for placing first. Team members include Elian Puentes, Demetrio Flores, Juan Torres, Hever Mercado, Sly Bernabe, and Gabriel Arellano. Thanks to everyone who competed and to everyone that came out to cheer them on!

div.div: Everyone invited to come out for the annual Color Walk. This year's location will be at the Plains T-Ball field. Hope to see you there!

font.span: Congrats to the following SWHJH students. These are their results from the SCCC Regional Science Fair that took place this weekend:

br.span: Hailey Saucedo- 2nd Place in Behavior Science (State Qualifier)
Adeline Woods- 1st Place in Biochemistry (State Qualifier)
Martin Garcia- 1st Place in Cellular Biology
Holling Sorter- 2nd Place in Materials Science
Yasmin Martinez and Layla Wright- 1st Place in Mathematics (State Qualifier)
German Garcia- 3rd Place in Physics and Astronomy
Lacie Banman- 1st Place in Physics and Astronomy (State Qualifier)
Emma Stanfield- 3rd Place in Plant Science (State Qualifier)
Rodrigo Sanchez and Julian Juarez (State Qualifier in Plant Science)

font.br: Individual medalists: Makenzie Arellano 1st Dramatic Solo; Izabella Warden 6th Dramatic Solo;Jentre Smith 6th poetry; Owen Vajnar 2nd Humorous Solo; Owen Vajnar & Lexi Williams 3rd Duet; Diana Hernandez and Klairy Rios 4th Duet; Kaleb Scripsick & Valick Sorter 4th IDA; Alexis Soto 4th OO; Harley Johnson 3rd Informative; Taylor Vermillion 5th Informative and 2nd Extemp; Valick Sorter 5th Impromptu.

strong.font:
The W.W. Orrison, MD scholarship is available to first-year college students. To apply, please send an official copy of your college transcript to Mrs. Sheldon at the address below or drop it off at the high school by March 1, 2020. Transcripts will be mailed to the Trust and is based on your college GPA. Last year the amount awarded was over $500!
Southwestern Heights High School
Attn: Colleen Sheldon
17222 Mustang Road
Kismet, KS 67859

span.font: Congratulations to the Forensics team for a great meet on Saturday. The team placed 2nd at Holcomb. Individual medalists were Ernesto Hernandez- 1st in Prose, Jentre Smith- 1st in DSA, Diana Hernandez- 2nd in DSA, Owen Vajnar- 4th in HSA, Judith Soto- 5th in Prose, Diana Hernandez and Klairy Rios- 5th in Duet, Makenzie Arellano-6th in DSA, Makenzie Arellano and Elian Puentes- 6th in Duet, Arlin Testa- 6th in Poetry, Valick Sorter- 6th in Impromptu, Ernesto Hernandez- 6th in POI, Valick Sorter and Kaleb Scripsick- 6th in IDA

font.span: Congratulations to Demetrio Flores on placing 1st at the Wichita County powerlifting meet! 1st in squat-430, bench-275, clean-255, & overall-960. This was after playing
27 minutes the night before in a basketball game. One of the hardest workers we have, leads by example!

img.style: margin-top: 5px; margin-bottom: 10px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 10px; border-width:1px;padding:3px; max-width:100%

span.style: display: table-caption; caption-side: bottom; font-size: 90%; margin-top: -10px; margin-bottom: 10px; text-align: center;

font.span: Congratulations to the varsity Scholars Bowl team for placing second at League in Meade yesterday. The team had a record of 3 wins and 2 losses. Team members are (front) Ernesto Hernandez, Rylee McDaniel, Elian Puentes (back) Valick Sorter, Owen Vajnar, Marcos Amparan.

br.br: The team will compete at Regional on Thursday, February 6th at Southwestern Heights. Come out and show your support. The top 3 teams from our Regional will go on to compete at State Scholars Bowl in Wichita on Saturday, February 15, 2020.

img.style: margin-top: 5px; margin-bottom: 10px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 10px; border-width:1px;padding:3px; max-width:100%

span.style: display: table-caption; caption-side: bottom; font-size: 90%; margin-top: -10px; margin-bottom: 10px; text-align: center;

span.font: 15 members of the KAY Club attended the Unit Conference in Ingalls. At the conference, students participated in community service projects, leadership activities, and learned from 2 very motivational speakers. Students had a superfantastic time and are excited to be bringing back ideas to better serve their school and their community.
It is a great day to be a KAY!
